title: Verified Purchase
content: I very rarely give a 5 star to any book. It has to be a really good book that is beautifully written and one in which I cannot put down. This was one of those books. The two main characters are Ana and Ester and their journey from Poland to a concentration camp. Ana is the midwife and Ester is Jewish. The author does an amazing job of bringing to life the horrors of WWII and the concentration camps. There are parts that made me cry, made me laugh, and truly torn at my heartstrings. I don’t like to give away any spoilers when I write a review, I want the reader to be surprised and hopefully compelled to read a book like this. We need to always remember our history. It is important that we don’t forget and that we remember the real history, not something made up to make someone feel better, is what should be taught.

title: Verified Purchase
content: This book was recommended to me by a friend, so it was my first book by Anna Stuart. I couldn't put this book down. I laughed, I cried, I cringed at some of the horrendous atrocities perpetrated on the women in the German concentration camp of Berkenau. There were many pregnant women and our heroines Ana and Ester were there to help them give birth just to see their babies drown in a bucket or die due to lack of nourishment or be taken away to be Germanized in a good German family loyal to the Third Reich.  For those who want to believe that the Holocaust never happened, this book sure will prove your thinking is in error.  But in the midst of the horror, hope springs eternal and joy truly does come in the morning! I can't recommend this book enough! I'll definitely be reading more by Anna Stuart.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
